title: Late Game Character Building
data:
***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

This guide covers basic character build strategy for players that already have at least one rune, and are planning to get 3-4 runes before leaving with the [Orb of Zot](/Orb_of_Zot "Orb of Zot"). This guide builds off what was covered in [mid-game strategy](/Mid_Game_Character_Building "Mid Game Character Building").

Wrapping up our skills for our characters...

## Contents

- [1 Melee Focused](#Melee_Focused)

  - [1.1 Weapon](#Weapon)
  - [1.2 Defense](#Defense)
  - [1.3 Range](#Range)

- [2 Spell Focused](#Spell_Focused)

  - [2.1 Weapon](#Weapon_2)
  - [2.2 Spellcasting](#Spellcasting)
  - [2.3 Spell Schools](#Spell_Schools)
  - [2.4 Defense](#Defense_2)

- [3 Spell Choice](#Spell_Choice)

  - [3.1 Choice by Armour](#Choice_by_Armour)

    - [3.1.1 Light (Robe)](#Light_.28Robe.29)
    - [3.1.2 Mid (Dragon Scales)](#Mid_.28Dragon_Scales.29)
    - [3.1.3 Heavy (Plate)](#Heavy_.28Plate.29)
    - [3.1.4 Natural](#Natural)

  - [3.2 Choice by category](#Choice_by_category)

## Melee Focused

Melee focused players remain heavy armour, heavy damage, melee fighters.

### Weapon

Weapon skill should go to all the way to your weapon's minimum delay, if you haven't reached it already. Most one-handers should already have reached mindelay, but the biggest weapons require more training:

- 24 for [Executioner's axe](/Executioner%27s_axe "Executioner's axe"), [Bardiche](/Bardiche "Bardiche"), [Giant spiked club](/Giant_spiked_club "Giant spiked club")
- 22 for [Triple sword](/Triple_sword "Triple sword")
- 20 for [Great mace](/Great_mace "Great mace"), [Battleaxe](/Battleaxe "Battleaxe"), [Glaive](/Glaive "Glaive"), [Great sword](/Great_sword "Great sword")

Even past mindelay, you can choose to keep training. The fine-tuning doesn't really matter at this stage; you can keep skill at the mindelay threshold, or continue training up to the maximum of 27. Weapons with lower mindelays, like [demon whips](/Demon_whip "Demon whip") and [eveningstars](/Eveningstar "Eveningstar"), will want at least a little more skill in order to improve their damage.

By now, many of the rarer weapons start to become available. Consult the [weapon choice](/Weapon_choice "Weapon choice") article for more details, though switching weapon schools by this stage is rarely a good idea. Regardless, Short Blades users should start considering swapping to Long Blades (or another weapon school). Stabbing an [orb of fire](/Orb_of_fire "Orb of fire") is, too often, an impossible task.

### Defense

If you've been training up specific skills, your main defenses: [Fighting](/Fighting "Fighting"), [Armour](/Armour "Armour"), [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging"), and/or [Shields](/Shields "Shields") might be lacking. Ideally, two of Armour, Dodging, and Shields should be at least ten, while Fighting still remains an important skill to train. Well before Zot, your fighting skill should surpass even your weapon skill in importance.

### Range

[Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing"), assuming you have plenty of [javelins](/Javelin "Javelin") left, should be raised anywhere from 10, up to the javelin mindelay of 16. Don't throw them all the time, or they'll run out quick (unless you are worshipping [Okawaru](/Okawaru "Okawaru")). [Size](/Size "Size") matters; [kobolds](/Kobold "Kobold") and [spriggans](/Spriggan "Spriggan") can't use javelins, while [trolls](/Troll "Troll") and [ogres](/Ogre "Ogre") might want to train further to boost [large rocks](/Large_rock "Large rock").

The same strategy applies to [Evocations](/Evocations "Evocations"), but as they have no mindelay, you can choose to train them up to 27. A [wand of acid](/Wand_of_acid "Wand of acid") and [wand of iceblast](/Wand_of_iceblast "Wand of iceblast") remain great for the entire game, while hex wands still have plenty of weaker targets to disable. Many of the XP [evocables](/Evocable "Evocable"), such as a [condenser vane](/Condenser_vane "Condenser vane") or [tin of tremorstones](/Tin_of_tremorstones "Tin of tremorstones"), also have great effects when invested into.

Once again, consider low-level utility spells like [Apportation](/Apportation "Apportation"), [Blink](/Blink "Blink"), and [Animate Dead](/Animate_Dead "Animate Dead"). By now, getting the skill for them should be much more realistic. Unless you plan to go beyond a 3-5 rune game, attacking spells simply won't be useful.

## Spell Focused

Spell focused characters focus their efforts on one or a few spells to do their deadly work.

### Weapon

If your character has extreme aptitudes for a weapon (+3 or +4), consider a melee focused end-game weapon. Otherwise, only bother with [magical staves](/Magical_staves "Magical staves"), one-handed weapons, or amazing [unrands](/Unrand "Unrand").

### Spellcasting

Spell levels start to become more of an issue as they get more complex. By now, you can also freely train spellcasting in order to raise maximum MP.

### Spell Schools

Assuming you've found a Zot viable spell, stick with that spell school. Think [Bombard](/Bombard "Bombard"), [Summon Horrible Things](/Summon_Horrible_Things "Summon Horrible Things"), [Orb of Destruction](/Orb_of_Destruction "Orb of Destruction"), or pretty much any level 9 spell. However, level 9 spells are difficult to cast if you don't have amazing aptitudes or some form of [wizardry](/Wizardry "Wizardry").

If you *haven't* found one, you should be planning ahead to switch foci *somewhere* well before you approach a second rune. Whenever it'd be melee, range, or another spell school, you know you'll have to deal with [ancient liches](/Ancient_lich "Ancient lich") and [orbs of fire](/Orbs_of_fire "Orbs of fire") in [Zot:5](/Zot:5 "Zot:5").

Once you found that spell, you'll want as much spellpower as possible for your offensive spells. More reliable, more powerful, the better.

### Defense

Once you get your Zot-killing spell viable, your defenses should become a greater priority. Typically, you'll want to train [Fighting](/Fighting "Fighting") and [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging"), as well as enough skill to cast while wearing a [shield](/Shield "Shield"). All two-three skills should be raised above level 12 or so.

## Spell Choice

By this point in the game, the amount of experience you have is so high that the lines between melee focused players and spell focused players gets considerably blurred. Thus, it's easiest to divide spell choice by armour level and category.

### Choice by Armour

#### Light (Robe)

Going with a [robe](/Robe "Robe"), [troll leather armour](/Troll_leather_armour "Troll leather armour"), or lighter [dragon scales](/Dragon_scales "Dragon scales") is the most common choice for spell-focused players. It's best for characters with no weapon or using a weapon only as emergency/clean-up. Any level of spell choice can be considered.

However, 9th level spells are still an awkward choice for some species even in robes. Minotaurs and Trolls, for example, should not even consider casting them. Other players may choose not to bother, using lesser attack spells like [Freezing Cloud](/Freezing_Cloud "Freezing Cloud") and taking advantage of a wider variety of utility spells with the spare spell slots.

#### Mid (Dragon Scales)

Players in fire dragon armour or heavier have generally foregone the thought of 9th level spells. Their highest level of offense is likely to be spells like [Borgnjor's Vile Clutch](/Borgnjor%27s_Vile_Clutch "Borgnjor's Vile Clutch"), [Bombard](/Bombard "Bombard"), and [Orb of Destruction](/Orb_of_Destruction "Orb of Destruction").

This is a choice best for those who either were formerly melee focused and now want some escape options, for those casters who don't wish to cast level 9 spells, or for those severely lacking in resists. Additionally, some species may be forced into it, with a lack of equipment options.

Furthermore, this is not a permanent decision, and heavy dragon armour may be used temporarily before learning higher level spells.

#### Heavy (Plate)

[Plate armour](/Plate_armour "Plate armour"), as well as [crystal plate armour](/Crystal_plate_armour "Crystal plate armour") and [gold dragon scales](/Gold_dragon_scales "Gold dragon scales"), are the choice for those foregoing offensive magic altogether. Exceptions include worshippers of the god [Cheibriados](/Cheibriados "Cheibriados"), the divine [demigods](/Demigod "Demigod"), and those going past a 3-runer.

#### Natural

Certain [Talismans](/Talisman "Talisman") will outright meld your armour with whatever your form provides. [Statue Form](/Statue_Form "Statue Form"), [Dragon Form](/Dragon_Form "Dragon Form"), and [Storm Form](/Storm_Form "Storm Form") all provide [AC](/AC "AC"), [HP](/HP "HP"), and/or [EV](/EV "EV"). These transformations do not disrupt casting.

Characters training a lot of [Shapeshifting](/Shapeshifting "Shapeshifting") may enjoy the benefit of a [Death talisman](/Death_talisman "Death talisman"), great for a 15-rune run, or simply closing out a 3-5 rune game. It does not meld any equipment slots, and provides interesting resistances and melee debuffs.

### Choice by category

If you choose to go with a 9th level spell, don't be picky: they are a massive investment in experience. You must have been training the school for most of the game to consider one. And unless you worship [Vehumet](/Vehumet "Vehumet") -- and sometimes even then -- you might not get a 9th level spell reliable until you're just finishing your last rune. Don't try to focus on them; it won't help you survive with your problems *now*. Get your defenses and utility skill up, first.

All players relying mostly on magic for offense should learn a high level non-elemental damage spell for Zot. [Lehudib's Crystal Spear](/Lehudib%27s_Crystal_Spear "Lehudib's Crystal Spear"), [Orb of Destruction](/Orb_of_Destruction "Orb of Destruction"), [Malign Gateway](/Malign_Gateway "Malign Gateway"), and [Dragon's Call](/Dragon%27s_Call "Dragon's Call") (for summoners) are all good choices. [Spellforged Servitor](/Spellforged_Servitor "Spellforged Servitor") is extremely helpful, if it can cast another high level damaging spell to begin with.

Low level spells start to become useless; physical options or Evocations are better for picking off foes.
